image.altText: Politician looks ahead at press conference

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory chief minister is spending her first overseas trip spruiking the NT's ability to host hundreds of Japanese Self-Defense Force soldiers each year.

title.children: NT leader flies to Japan in bid to draw defence troops to Darwin

image.altText: People marching for NAIDOC Rally. One lady holds a sign that reads 'Treaty Now'.

props.synopsis: For Aboriginal people, it has been centuries in the making. As Victoria tables legislation for the country's first treaty with First Nations people, Indigenous leaders are urging other states and territories to follow suit.

title.children: First Nations leaders applaud Australia's first treaty centuries in the making

image.altText: A white land cruiser is smashed by a large tree that has been uprooted by wind

props.synopsis: Strong winds uprooted trees, with branches and entire trunks landing on cars and roads when a storm hit Alice Springs.

title.children: Residents clean up after surprise storm lashes Alice Springs

image.altText: A small dinghy approaches a large fishing boat

props.synopsis: The Australian Border Force is launching a reporting function on a popular fishing app, but stakeholders in the far north say the technology means little without more boots on the ground. Â

title.children: Border Force turns to popular app to help fight illegal fishing

image.altText: A man with dark hair and a beard, standing with his arms crossed.

props.synopsis: Fifteen years after it was first earmarked for "pedestrian infrastructure", a 1 kilometre-long road in Darwin's north remains dangerously underdeveloped, according to residents and local politicians.

title.children: Urgent calls for overdue upgrades on dangerous Darwin road

image.altText: Jacinta Nampijinpa Price standing and smiling.

props.synopsis: An Indian society in Darwin has written to Jacinta Nampijinpa Price, calling the NT senator's comments about Indian migration to Australia "racist" and "ill-founded".

title.children: Senator's Indian constituents call for apology over 'offensive' comments

image.altText: topless man holds crocodile

props.synopsis: Viral footage of a US social media star handling a deadly saltwater crocodile in Far North Queensland has sparked calls to deport misbehaving influencers.

title.children: Calls for travel ban on risky influencers after croc encounter

image.altText: A dark-coloured muscle car smokes up its tyres while performing a burnout.

props.synopsis: The 11th edition of the festival has come to an end, but not before injecting millions into the local economy and organisers say there is plenty more to come.

title.children: Red CentreNATS wraps up in Alice Springs as five-year deal confirmed

image.altText: A group of protesters shout and hold their arms aloft in front of a burning building

props.synopsis: Anti-government protests erupt into deadly violence, with Nepalese youth venting their frustration over a political system they accuse of corruption.

title.children: Nepal's capital burns as PM's resignation sparks anarchy concerns

image.altText: Trump, Melania, Epstein and Maxwell pose for a photo in 2002

props.synopsis: The White House says it will support a forensic analysis of the signature on a birthday letter allegedly given by Donald Trump to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.

title.children: Trump's alleged signature on Epstein birthday note to be analysed

image.altText: A close up of Donald Trump's face as he looks over his shoulder with a casual expression.

props.synopsis: A Supreme Court that has been reluctant to check Donald Trump's flex of executive authority will decide in November whether to uphold lower-court rulings against his trade tariffs.

title.children: Trump's trade tariffs rush to Supreme Court

image.altText: A young man and an older man sit together in sporting stands

props.synopsis: Rupert Murdoch's family has always been close. But if you really want to trace the extent of filial and sibling affection, you need to follow the money.

title.children: Lachlan emerges as winner but Murdoch hold on News and Fox more vulnerable

image.altText: A child's hands play with nylon strings on an acoustic guitar

props.synopsis: Music and art therapists will be able to bill NDIS participants at the same rate as counsellors after a review found the therapies could be effective in the right circumstances.

title.children: NDIS call made on music and art therapy after review of evidence base

image.altText: image of two three adults and two children in a kitchen posing as for a family photoshoot.

props.synopsis: Friends Gem and Renata have saved money buying a home together with their respective families in Wollongong, and say the pay-off goes much further.

title.children: Friends combine finances to buy dream home together

image.altText: NAB bank signage in red, black and white colours

props.synopsis: NAB becomes the latest bank to announce significant job cuts, Wall Street's fresh record highs are unlikely to drive Australian share market much higher, and an interest rate cut in the US this month looks increasingly certain. See how the trading day unfolds on our blog.

title.children: NAB to slash 410 jobs and hire more workers overseas

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ASX largely flat as banks offset lithium-led mining losses
Potential high-rise apartment locations in Melbourne's suburbs mapped
Why are ASX lithium stocks being sold off?

image.altText: Deputy Prime Minister Richard Marles speaks at a press conference watched by WA Premier Roger Cook.

props.synopsis: Defence Minister Richard Marles says Australia will spend $1.7 billion to acquire a fleet of autonomous Ghost Shark submarines. Follow Live.

title.children: Australia to spend $1.7b on autonomous Ghost Shark submarines

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Australia and Fiji to negotiate new bilateral security treaty
Richard Marles announces $1.7 billion for 'ghost shark' submarines
Response to Nampijinpa Price's remarks 'poorly handled' by opposition leader: Hume

image.altText: A teen girl with hair over her faces looks down at the ground in a dimly lit street.

props.synopsis: After her daughter's school suggested her 9-year-old find a "secret" way to tell her teacher she was being bullied, one parent has demanded change.

title.children: Parents demand change as 9yo told to 'not be so much of a target' for bullies

image.altText: A closeup of a ready-to-be-harvested medicinal cannabis plant.

props.synopsis: Despite more than 600 reports of "adverse events" for medicinal cannabis in the past three years, the Therapeutic Goods Administration (TGA) is yet to investigate the safety of most medicinal cannabis products. It has now launched a review.Â

title.children: Psychiatrists fear medicinal cannabis adverse events are 'tip of the iceberg'

image.altText: A piece of wood with dark trails inside.

props.synopsis: It's barely the size of a sesame seed, but the shot hole borer has quickly devastated Western Australia's tree canopy. Experts are warning other states and territories to take action now to avoid a similar fate.

title.children: Australia on alert as shot-hole borer wipes out thousands of trees

image.altText: two men working on a roof wearing hivis gear

props.synopsis: Construction workers are nearly twice as likely to take their own lives as other employed Australian men of the same age. Understanding the risks can help us better support those we know in the industry.

title.children: There is a high rate of suicide in construction. Here's what to look for

image.altText: Ange Postecoglou rubs his chin

props.synopsis: Australian's Ange Postecolgou has been named as new head coach of Premier League side Nottingham Forest after the sacking of Nuno EspÃ­rito Santo.

title.children: Postecoglou makes Premier League return with Nottingham Forest

image.altText: A composite image of two boys who were victims of a fatal knife attack

props.synopsis: Community leaders call for justice for 12-year-old Chol Achiek and 15-year-old Dau Akueng, who were murdered in what investigators say may have been a case of mistaken identity.

title.children: Mourners honour beloved boys killed in violent Melbourne attack

image.altText: Looking upwards in a rainforest through palms and trees.

props.synopsis: A groundbreaking study has revealed the extraordinarily rich biodiversity of Australia's islands and experts say it shows tighter controls are needed to protect the most diverse island of them all.

title.children: 'Bleak' outlook for K'gari unless visitor numbers capped, experts say

image.altText: Roger Cook, wearing a blue shirt, chats with an fishermen and baits a hook on a jetty.

props.synopsis: Recreational fishers and commercial guides fear being locked out of some of Western Australia's most pristine waters under plans to protect the globally significant Exmouth Gulf.

title.children: Fishers left reeling by Exmouth Gulf Marine Park announcement

image.altText: Former Thai Prime Minister Thaksin Shinawatra wearing black suit and red tie.

props.synopsis: Thaksin Shinawatra has dominated Thai politics for decades, but a short stint in a VIP wing of a hospital ultimately secured the undoing of one of the world's great political survivors.

title.children: From 'exiled martyr' to prisoner â the rise and fall of a Thai political powerhouse

image.altText: Alex Greenwich speaks into a microphone while wearing a white shirt and dark tie

props.synopsis: A legislated medical defence for drivers using medically prescribed cannabis was recommended by last year's drug summit. Independent MP Alex Greenwich, who takes medical cannabis, is pushing for reform.

title.children: MPs push for reforms on drivers who take prescribed medicinal cannabis

image.altText: A Socceroos forward grins while carrying a teammate on his back, celebrating a goal.

props.synopsis: Mohamed Toure and Nestory Irankunda dazzle after being handed a rare opportunity to start under Tony Popovic as the Socceroos retain the 'Soccer Ashes' with a commanding win over New Zealand in Auckland.

title.children: Irankunda and Toure give Socceroos a World Cup headache after dazzling against NZ

image.altText: A composite image of people breaking in to a supermarket.

props.synopsis: The boss of a supermarket chain is considering closing down stores, warning retail workers are facing unprecedented levels of violence and aggressive behaviour on an almost daily basis.

title.children: 'Crisis point': Supermarket chain considering closing stores due to rise in retail crime

image.altText: A composite image of Brittany Higgins and Linda Reynolds.

props.synopsis: Brittany Higgins has been ordered to pay the lion's share of her former boss Linda Reynolds's legal expenses in the blockbuster defamation trial that concluded last month.

title.children: Brittany Higgins ordered to pay Reynolds's court costs, exceeding $1m

image.altText: Pat Cummins licks his lips

props.synopsis: Pat Cummins is adamant there are no depth issues around Australia's bowling ahead of the Ashes, at a time when England are building back towards full strength.

title.children: Cummins hails bowling depth despite injury concerns

image.altText: A woman with brown hair in braids takes out her mouthguard and looks to the side.

props.synopsis: The Women's Rugby World Cup, currently being held in England, is trialling a revolutionary approach to concussion management. Players are wearing LED mouthguards which light up when a player sustains a hit that could result in a concussion.

title.children: How flashing mouthguards are being used to combat sport's biggest problem

image.altText: Person smiles holding close to their face a small medical container with yellow lid and word "sperm" on it.

props.synopsis: Krishna Istha has made a habit of turning to performance to solve a problem. So when they needed help to find a sperm donor, the solution was obvious.

title.children: Why Krishna Istha turned to art to find a sperm donor

image.altText: Anne Luijten sits on the ground

props.synopsis: The president of World Athletics, Sebastian Coe, takes aim at world leaders for their inaction on climate change, saying the upcoming World Championships will face "heat challenges" due to a Tokyo heatwave.

title.children: 'Heat challenges' to impact Tokyo World Championships

image.altText: A close-up image of a child's hand playing with blocks

props.synopsis: The Minns Government will push ahead with what it describes as "landmark" legislation to make the childcare sector safer.

title.children: NSW government flags crackdown on childcare centres with proposed reforms

image.altText: A woman in black cardigan with purple hair looks into the distance.

props.synopsis: After losing two years of her life to a poker machine addiction, Bec Healy wants the SA government to put its revenue from gambling into harm reduction.

title.children: Recovering gambling addict wants 'moral' use for pokies millions
